moves.1. f4: Bird's opening, not my favorite, suggesting a weaker king's side...
moves.1... f5: Unconventionally stopping the white pawn advancing and keeping the e5 for later on
moves.2. Nf3 e6: Protecting the f5 pawn and opening the queen & bishop's diagonals for attack on the black squares
moves.3. e3: Same move on the other side...
moves.3... d5: Black aims at kind of Stonewall in the centre...
moves.4. a3: Not really sure where this leads to...
moves.4... Bd6: Further supporting the centre. Although it might look as a waste of time at first, it could appear quite fundamental further.
moves.5... h6 6. Be2 g5: G Pawn advances strongly putting some pressure on the f pawn and weekening further the K side.
moves.7. Bb2: Strong move by white occupying the a1 - h8 diagonal. Now I understand what those pawn moves earlier were aimed at:)
moves.7... Rh7: Rook hast to lift up and I do not really mind it.
moves.8. Ne5: Quite useless attack in my oppinion at that point, but ok it oppens a diagonal for attack to the white King...
moves.8... Nf6: I have to protect these white squares...it might get dangerous...
moves.9. Ng6: White opens his black diagonal and trys to put pressure on my Knight.
moves.10. Bh5: Lingering check on the black king with a open knight attacking move.
moves.10... fxe3: Black pawn captures escaping the white knight's attack and endangering further
moves.11... Nbd7: Supporting my knight and developing further
moves.12. Nf4+: Check comes. I have to support that e6 pawn.
moves.12... Ke7 13. Bg6: Thanks for letting me develop even more...
moves.14... Qg8: White king's side starts to look really vulnerable...
moves.15. Bf3 Ne5: I need this white bishop out of there
moves.16. O-O: White castles against my strong g file! I cannot believe it, although there is still plenty work to do...
moves.16... Neg4: I decide to put pressure on white's e-pawn and get the centre...
moves.17. Qd4: Strong move by the black having the Q ruling the centre and endangering this notorious black diagonal.
moves.17... c5: Here pawn xe5 also could be an option.
moves.18. Qc3: Q retreats but still keeps the presure.
moves.18... e5: I'm trying to loose it a bit and starting a nice attack at the same time.
moves.19. Nd2: Another very good developing move by white, but does he see my lingering attack options there...I guess...
moves.19... Qf7: Queen supports and looking for more weekness in black's defence ...
moves.20. Ne2: The white knight is maybe scared...at the same time he keeps that pressure from the white Queen on the black squares diagonal
moves.20... Nxh2: However the Black attack starts slowly but surely sacraficing a good knight.
moves.21. Kxh2: White king goes for it. he still doesn't feel much endangered.
moves.21... d4: Let's put some pressure on the Queen first. I need her out of there to develop my attack on the K's side.
moves.22. Qc4: White Q moves offering exchange. I do not go for it.
moves.23. Kg1: And white King hides back into his little hole...
moves.23... Be6: I need my Queen and at the same time here comes the second rook too.
moves.24. Qb5: Now I have to take care of whites attack on the weakend black King's side and support the centre.
moves.25. Bxe4: White starts a kind of attack, but isn't it too late?
moves.26... Rxg2+: Did white think of this? I don't think so:)
moves.27. Kxg2: From here on is game over. Thanks for watching!
